intro: Hieracium crocatum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium crocatum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
